duration_in_months: All TBIPS SA Holders currently holding a TBIPS SA for Tier 1 under the EN578-170432 series of SA's are invited to bid on this requirement.
full_summary:
### TBIPS – Salish Sea Initiative (SSI) Contract Opportunity

The Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) is inviting qualified contractors to submit a proposal for the provision of TBIPS (Task-Based Informatics Professional Services) to support the development and enhancement of the Salish Sea Initiative (SSI) project. This project involves the creation of an interactive map, data portal, and mobile field survey app to support the management of marine ecosystems and conservation efforts in the Salish Sea region.

**Contract Overview**

*   Contract Title: TBIPS – Salish Sea Initiative (SSI)
*   Contract Number: 30003724
*   Solicitation Method: Competitive
*   Application: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
*   Services Required:
    *   1 Geomatics Analyst – Junior Level
    *   3 Geomatics Analysts – Senior Level
    *   2 Geographic Information System Programmers/Analysts – Intermediate Level
    *   3 Geographic Information System Project Managers – Senior Level

**Implementation Period and Tasks**
The contract duration is expected to be for one year from the date of contract award. The work will involve the co-development of the SSI project using a unique collaborative approach. 

The preferred start date for the contract is November 1, 2023, with an expected completion date of October 31, 2024. The contract award process will include Task-Based Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) under the EN578-170432 series of Supply Arrangements.

**Eligibility Requirements**

To be eligible, contractors must have a valid TBIPS Supply Arrangement and be Tier 1 qualified under the category "Geomatics Analyst" or "Geographic Information System Programmer/Analyst" for the required services.

**Contracting Authority**

Bassam El-Daya (Bassam.El-Daya@dfo-mpo.gc.ca) is the Contracting Authority for this contract. 

**Proposal Instructions**

The RFP (Request for Proposal) documents will be sent directly to qualified Supply Arrangement Holders who are invited to bid. The interested parties are advised that the distribution of solicitation documents is not the responsibility of BuyAndSell.GC.CA. The Crown Agency retains the right to negotiate with any supplier. 

For more information regarding this RFP, please contact the Contracting Authority. Proposal should be submitted in accordance with the prescribed formats for TBIPS, and demonstrate the ability to fulfill the requirements of the project.   The contractor selected
